page.title: 11Changing Times.
page.content: The area is crossed by a ridgeway which was an important route from very early times.Today it is almost entirely residential. Elderly people in this area were interviewed, one of them, an old lady who had lived here for 64 years.The greatest changes most of them found, was the amount of traffic along the main arterial roads which tend to divide the area. Many of the streets contain terraced houses built between 1860 and the start of the century, but around the areas of {Stoke Hill, Hill Barton}and{Whipton} are newer homes built since 1940. Most of that area was fields with farms bordering the terraced houses. Most of the elderly people felt that the changes had brought improvement and that the area was now a better place to live in.(Ladysmith Middle School).
